informal: For every Box-structure B with full δ–Φ–Π–μ–λ–ψ–Σ–Θ–χ–Ω–ρ signature, there exists a unique Ξ(B) that meta-synthesizes all operator layers into a single Ξ-state, and every well-typed expression over these operators admits a unique Ξ-normal form.
formal: 1) Existence of meta-synthesis:

For every admissible Box B, there exists a Ξ-state Ξ(B) and a canonical morphism η\_B: B → Ξ(B) such that Ξ(B) is obtained by functorially aggregating the actions of (δ, Φ, Π, μ, λ, ψ, Σ, Θ, χ, Ω, ρ) on B.
2) Uniqueness / terminality:

For any other candidate meta-synthesis object X with a morphism α\_B: B → X that factorizes all lower-tier actions, there exists a unique isomorphism u\_B: Ξ(B) → X such that α\_B \= u\_B ∘ η\_B. Thus Ξ(B) is terminal among meta-synthesis objects for B.
3) Functoriality:
For every morphism f: B → B' preserving the operator structure, there is an induced morphism Ξ(f): Ξ(B) → Ξ(B') such that:
and Ξ respects composition and identities (Ξ(id\_B) \= id\_Ξ(B), Ξ(f ∘ g) \= Ξ(f) ∘ Ξ(g)).
4) Xi-normal-form property:
Let Expr be any well-typed composition over {δ, Φ, Π, μ, λ, ψ, Σ, Θ, χ, Ω, ρ, Ξ, ΞG, ΞL, Ξ⊗, Ξ⊕, Ξ-\>NF, Ξ\*}.
There exists a unique expression NF\_Ξ(Expr) in Ξ-normal form such that:
Ξ-\>NF ∘ Expr \= NF\_Ξ(Expr),
and Expr ≡ Expr' (axiomatically) if and only if NF\_Ξ(Expr) \= NF\_Ξ(Expr').
5) Compatibility with Ω and ρ:
(a) Global constraint absorption:
Ξ ∘ Ω \= Ω^Ξ, where Ω^Ξ is an internal normalization on Ξ(B) such that all Ω-invariants are preserved and represented intrinsically in Ξ(B).
(b) Layer/meta-hierarchy absorption:
Ξ ∘ ρ \= ρ^Ξ, where ρ^Ξ is a stratified meta-layer structure internal to Ξ(B) such that every ρ-layer of B is realized as a sub-structure or quotient of Ξ(B).
6) Xi-closure:
For every Box B, Ξ(B) is closed under all induced actions of the lifted operators:
δ^Ξ, Φ^Ξ, Π^Ξ, μ^Ξ, λ^Ξ, ψ^Ξ, Σ^Ξ, Θ^Ξ, χ^Ξ, Ω^Ξ, ρ^Ξ,
and these satisfy the same defining axioms of the lower-tier families, now internalized in the Ξ-state.
